column4: Hello, is anyone able to offer any help with how enable a wireless connection please?  I've been trying for hours and I'm close to throwing my laptop out of the window
what wifi chip does it use?
how have you been trying 'for hurs' without knowing the wifi chip!?
what could you possibly achieve without knowing the chip
if you run: sudo lshw -C network      the product line will tell you the chip, what is it?
also do you dual boot?
also, what is the output of:    lsb_release -sc
can you give the output of the commands I gave please, the lshw command will be large but we only need one line
did you disable the ability for the wireless chip to wake up the system as well as disable power management. This can affect how the device works in other OSes because windows is garbage
scroll up
(11:48:55) ActionParsnip: koko_: also, what is the output of:    lsb_release -sc
in the lshw command, what is the product line of the wireless?
and the lsb_release -sc   command please
thanks, what exactly have you been doing for these hours you have tried to get this working when you didn't even know the wifi chip?
genuine question, what have you tried?
disable the adapter's ability to wake up the system as well as power management, it helps in dual boots
in windows device manager

Hi, I just came back to say thanks for your patience and support earlier with regard to my wireless problem.  I have resolved the issue now with the commands: rfkill list all;  rfkill unblock all.    Thank you
add that to your startup and it will run automagically
glad you got the gold
thanks!
